original: @430a / /rgya gar skad du /🔽gi ri a'a nanda s'u tra /
analyzed: @430a / /rgya gar skad du / gi ri a'a nanda s'u tra /
translated: In Sanskrit:🔽Girisanand sutra

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: ri'i kun dga' bo'i mdo /
analyzed: ri'i kun dga' bo'i mdo /
translated: The Sutra of Mountain Ananda

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog gsum la gus pas phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog gsum la gus pas phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Three Jewels!

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time:

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod rgyal byed tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod rgyal byed tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in the Jeta Grove, in Anathapindika's park in Shravasti.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo nad dam po sdug bsngal bas gzir to //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bor bcom ldan 'das ga la @430b ba der song zhing nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo nad dam po sdug bsngal bas gzir to // de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bor bcom ldan 'das ga la @430b ba der song zhing nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: At that time, the venerable Mountain Ananda was afflicted by a severe illness and suffering.🔽Then the venerable Ananda went to where the Blessed One was, approached him, paid homage to the Blessed One, and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas yang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas yang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having sat to one side, the venerable Ananda said this to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa / tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo nad dam po sdug bsngal bas gzir to //
analyzed: btsun pa / tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo nad dam po sdug bsngal bas gzir to //
translated: “Lord, the venerable Rāṣṭrapāla is gravely ill and in pain.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord, Blessed One,

original: legs par mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: legs par mdzad du gsol /
translated: please do so.

original: dge slong tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo ga la ba der gshegs la rjes su brtse bas gshegs par zhu /
analyzed: dge slong tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo ga la ba der gshegs la rjes su brtse bas gshegs par zhu /
translated: Please go out of compassion to the venerable Rāṣṭrapāla.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: der yang / kun dga' bo /
analyzed: der yang / kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: khyod dge slong ri'i kun dga' bo'i thad du song la 'du shes bcu bshad par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyod dge slong ri'i kun dga' bo'i thad du song la 'du shes bcu bshad par gyis shig /
translated: you should go to the monk Rāṣṭrapāla and explain the ten perceptions.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i gnas su smra bar gyis shig /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i gnas su smra bar gyis shig /
translated: You should speak of the abode of consciousness.

original: gzhan yang / dge slong ri'i kun dga' bos 'du shes bcu thos nas nad kyis gzir ba'i gnas rnams la so sor rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang / dge slong ri'i kun dga' bos 'du shes bcu thos nas nad kyis gzir ba'i gnas rnams la so sor rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, monk Rāṣṭrapāla, having heard the ten perceptions, will understand the states of being afflicted by illness.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes dang / bar du gcod pa'i 'du shes dang / spong ba'i 'du shes dang; 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'du shes dang / 'gog pa'i 'du shes dang /🔽'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes dang // 'du byed thams @431a *//
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes dang / bar du gcod pa'i 'du shes dang / spong ba'i 'du shes dang; 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'du shes dang / 'gog pa'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes dang // 'du byed thams @431a *//
translated: the perception of impermanence, the perception of no-self, the perception of the impurity of the body, the perception of the drawbacks, the perception of abandonment, the perception of detachment, the perception of cessation,

original: cad la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / 'byung ba dang / rdub pa rjes su dran pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: cad la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / 'byung ba dang / rdub pa rjes su dran pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: the perception of the undesirability of all worldly realms, the perception of the impermanence of all conditioned things, and the perception of the mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes du zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes du zhe na /
translated: “What is the perception of impermanence?

original: 'di ni tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dgon pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ni tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dgon pa'am /
translated: Venerable Ānanda, go to a solitary place,

original: shing drung ngam /
analyzed: shing drung ngam /
translated: to the foot of a tree,

original: khang pa stong par song la 'di ni so sor rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khang pa stong par song la 'di ni so sor rig par bya'o //
translated: or to an empty building, and reflect on this:

original: gzugs mi rtag pa dang / tshor ba mi rtag pa dang / 'du shes mi rtag pa dang; 'du byed mi rtag pa dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag pa dang / tshor ba mi rtag pa dang / 'du shes mi rtag pa dang; 'du byed mi rtag pa dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa ste /
translated: ‘Form is impermanent, feeling is impermanent, perception is impermanent, formation is impermanent, and consciousness is impermanent.

original: 'di rnams la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po mi rtag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po mi rtag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should view these five appropriated aggregates as impermanent.

original: de la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ston cig; kun dga' bo /
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ston cig; kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda, teach the perception of impermanence.

original: bdag med pa'i 'du shes du zhe na /🔽'di ni dge slong kun dga' bo /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i 'du shes du zhe na / 'di ni dge slong kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda, what is the perception of selflessness?🔽This, Ānanda, is the perception of selflessness.

original: dgon pa'am / shing drung ngam /
analyzed: dgon pa'am / shing drung ngam /
translated: A monk should go to a solitary place, or the foot of a tree,

original: khang pa stong par song la 'di ni so sor rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khang pa stong par song la 'di ni so sor rig par bya'o //
translated: or an empty building, and contemplate this.

original: mig bdag med pa dang / gzugs bdag med pa dang / rna ba bdag med pa dang / sgra bdag med pa dang / sna bdag med pa dang / dri bdag med pa dang / lce bdag med pa dang / ro bdag med pa dang /
analyzed: mig bdag med pa dang / gzugs bdag med pa dang / rna ba bdag med pa dang / sgra bdag med pa dang / sna bdag med pa dang / dri bdag med pa dang / lce bdag med pa dang / ro bdag med pa dang /
translated: The eye is selfless, forms are selfless, the ear is selfless, sounds are selfless, the nose is selfless, smells are selfless, the tongue is selfless, tastes are selfless,

original: lus bdag med pa dang / reg bya bdag med pa dang / yid bdag med pa dang / chos bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: lus bdag med pa dang / reg bya bdag med pa dang / yid bdag med pa dang / chos bdag med pa ste /
translated: the body is selfless, tactile objects are selfless, the mind is selfless, and phenomena are selfless.

original: 'di rnams ni nang gi drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug bdag med pa'o; ;bdag med pa la lta zhing bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni nang gi drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug bdag med pa'o; ;bdag med pa la lta zhing bsam par bya'o //
translated: These are the six internal sense bases and the six external sense bases that are selfless. One should view and contemplate selflessness.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: bdag med pa 'di rnams ston cig /
analyzed: bdag med pa 'di rnams ston cig /
translated: Teach these to be selfless.”

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes ni /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes ni /
translated: the perception of impurity

original: dge slong @431b kun dga' bo //
analyzed: dge slong @431b kun dga' bo //
translated: is as follows, O monk Ānanda:

original: 'di ni lus 'di nyid la spyi gtsug nas 'og gi rkang mthil gyi bar gyi pags pa'i phyi shun gyi bar gang bar rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mi gtsang ba so sor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lus 'di nyid la spyi gtsug nas 'og gi rkang mthil gyi bar gyi pags pa'i phyi shun gyi bar gang bar rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mi gtsang ba so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: “In this very body, from the top of the head down to the soles of the feet, one should investigate the various kinds of impurities that fill it, down to the outer skin.

original: lus 'di la skra dang / kha spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / pags pa'i phyi shun dang / sha dang / chu ba dang / rus pa dang / rkang mar dang / mkhal ma dang; snying dang / mcher pa dang / glo ba dang /
analyzed: lus 'di la skra dang / kha spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / pags pa'i phyi shun dang / sha dang / chu ba dang / rus pa dang / rkang mar dang / mkhal ma dang; snying dang / mcher pa dang / glo ba dang /
translated: In this body there are hair of the head, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidney, heart, liver, spleen, lungs,

original: sul mang dang / pho ba dang / rgyu ma dang / rgyu ma'i gnye ma dang / lgang pa dang / rtug pa dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang; tshigs dang / khrag dang / rdul dang / tshil dang / mchi ma dang /
analyzed: sul mang dang / pho ba dang / rgyu ma dang / rgyu ma'i gnye ma dang / lgang pa dang / rtug pa dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang; tshigs dang / khrag dang / rdul dang / tshil dang / mchi ma dang /
translated: large intestines, small intestines, gorge, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, grease, fat, tears,

original: zhag dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / chu ser dang / gcin dang / klad pa ste mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: zhag dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / chu ser dang / gcin dang / klad pa ste mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: thirty-two impure substances: hair of the head, hair of the body, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidney, heart, liver, spleen, lungs, small intestines, large intestines, stomach, mesentery, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, lymph, saliva, mucus, oil that moistens the joints, urine.

original: lus 'di la mi gtsang bar lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lus 'di la mi gtsang bar lta bar bya'o //
translated: One should see this body as impure.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: mi gtsang ba 'di rnams bstan par gyis shig /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba 'di rnams bstan par gyis shig /
translated: teach these impurities.

original: kun dga' bo bar du gcod pa rnam pa du zhe na /
analyzed: kun dga' bo bar du gcod pa rnam pa du zhe na /
translated: Ānanda, what are the various obstacles?

original: dge slong kun dga' bo /
analyzed: dge slong kun dga' bo /
translated: Bhikṣu Ānanda,

original: 'di ni dgon pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ni dgon pa'am /
translated: go to a solitary place,

original: shing drung ngam /
analyzed: shing drung ngam /
translated: the foot of a tree,

original: khang stong du song ste 'di rnams so sor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: khang stong du song ste 'di rnams so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: an empty building, and contemplate these.

original: lus 'di ni sdug bsngal ming ba dang / bar du gcod pa mang ba ste /
analyzed: lus 'di ni sdug bsngal ming ba dang / bar du gcod pa mang ba ste /
translated: This body is full of suffering and many obstacles.

original: lus 'di la rnam pa du ma'i nad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lus 'di la rnam pa du ma'i nad 'byung ngo //
translated: Many kinds of illnesses arise in this body.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mig gi nad dang / rna ba'i nad dang / sna'i nad dang / lce'i nad dang / lus @432a *//
analyzed: mig gi nad dang / rna ba'i nad dang / sna'i nad dang / lce'i nad dang / lus @432a *//
translated: eye disease, ear disease, nose disease, tongue disease, body disease,

original: kyi nad dang / mgo bo'i nad dang / rna ba'i nang gi nad dang / kha'i nad dang / so'i nad dang / glo dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / ba ni so'i nad dang; tsha rims dang / lto ba'i nad dang / brgyal ba dang /
analyzed: kyi nad dang / mgo bo'i nad dang / rna ba'i nang gi nad dang / kha'i nad dang / so'i nad dang / glo dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / ba ni so'i nad dang; tsha rims dang / lto ba'i nad dang / brgyal ba dang /
translated: diseases of the lips, fevers, diseases of the stomach, fainting,🔽diseases of the half body, pain, vomiting, leprosy, skin diseases, small pox, tuberculosis, epilepsy,

original: gzhog phyed na ba dang / gzer ba dang / gsud pa dang / mdze dang / sha 'bras dang / 'brum bu phra mo dang / gcong nad dang / brjed byed kyi nad dang / bas bldags dang / g-yan pa dang / lus za ba dang /
analyzed: gzhog phyed na ba dang / gzer ba dang / gsud pa dang / mdze dang / sha 'bras dang / 'brum bu phra mo dang / gcong nad dang / brjed byed kyi nad dang / bas bldags dang / g-yan pa dang / lus za ba dang /
translated: itching, scabies,🔽rakṣa, viṭa, raktapitta, madhu,

original: raksha sa dang / bi tsa ra tsi ka dang / khrag mkhris dang / ma dhu ma ha dang; aam ga dang / si la ka dang / mtshan mar rdol ba dang / mkhris pa 'khrugs pa'i nad dang / bad kan 'khrugs pa'i nad dang /
analyzed: raksha sa dang / bi tsa ra tsi ka dang / khrag mkhris dang / ma dhu ma ha dang; aam ga dang / si la ka dang / mtshan mar rdol ba dang / mkhris pa 'khrugs pa'i nad dang / bad kan 'khrugs pa'i nad dang /
translated: angā, śilā, fistula, diseases of disturbed bile, diseases of disturbed phlegm,

original: rlung 'khrugs pa'i nad dang / 'dus pa'i nad dang / dus su zas yi khar mi 'ong ba'i nad dang / mi mnyam pa'i nad 'khrugs pa dang / aa au pa ka smri ka'i nad dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa'i nad dang / grang ba dang /
analyzed: rlung 'khrugs pa'i nad dang / 'dus pa'i nad dang / dus su zas yi khar mi 'ong ba'i nad dang / mi mnyam pa'i nad 'khrugs pa dang / aa au pa ka smri ka'i nad dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa'i nad dang / grang ba dang /
translated: diseases caused by disturbed wind, bile, and phlegm, diseases caused by a combination of these, diseases caused by irregular eating, diseases caused by disturbances of the humors, diseases caused by the ripening of karma, and diseases caused by cold,

original: dro ba dang / bkres rngab dang / skom pa dang / 'khru ba dang / chu nad de /
analyzed: dro ba dang / bkres rngab dang / skom pa dang / 'khru ba dang / chu nad de /
translated: heat, hunger, thirst, diarrhea, and dysentery.

original: lus kyi nad 'di rnams ni bar du gcod par blta zhing bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi nad 'di rnams ni bar du gcod par blta zhing bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Ānanda, you should regard and cultivate these as obstacles.

original: kun dga' bo //
analyzed: kun dga' bo //
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'di ni bar du gcod par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bar du gcod par bstan par bya'o //
translated: these are taught to be obstacles.

original: kun dga' bo //
analyzed: kun dga' bo //
translated: Ānanda,

original: spong ba'i 'du shes rnams du zhe na /
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du shes rnams du zhe na /
translated: how many perceptions of abandonment are there?

original: dge slong kun dga' bo /
analyzed: dge slong kun dga' bo /
translated: Bhikṣu Ānanda,

original: @432b 'di ni 'dod pas skyes pa ste /
analyzed: @432b 'di ni 'dod pas skyes pa ste /
translated: this is born from desire.

original: mi gnas par dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnas par dor bar bya'o //
translated: It should be abandoned without dwelling on it.

original: rnam par gzhig pa dang / goms par mi byed pa dang / mi sgom par 'gro ba dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam rtog las skyes pa dang / mi gnas pa ste dor bar bya'o //🔽rnam par gzhig pa dang / goms par mi byed pa dang / mi sgom par 'gro ba ste /🔽skyes shing skyes pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi gnas pa ste dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhig pa dang / goms par mi byed pa dang / mi sgom par 'gro ba dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam rtog las skyes pa dang / mi gnas pa ste dor bar bya'o // rnam par gzhig pa dang / goms par mi byed pa dang / mi sgom par 'gro ba ste / skyes shing skyes pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi gnas pa ste dor bar bya'o //
translated: They are to be destroyed, not cultivated, not developed, not made a basis, not adhered to, not made one’s system, not made firm, not made unalterable, not made unchangeable, not made unreviewable, not made unabandonable, not made uninterruptible, not made uninterruptable by others, not made uninterruptable by the disciples, not made uninterruptable by the pratyekabuddhas, not made original: 'di ni 'dus byas thams cad gnas pa dang / skye ba dang / sgyur ba dang / sred par zad pa dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus byas thams cad gnas pa dang / skye ba dang / sgyur ba dang / sred par zad pa dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: This is the abiding, arising, transformation, and cessation of all conditioned things, as well as their extinction, cessation, and nirvāṇa.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'di ni 'gog pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gog pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: this is the perception of cessation.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes du zhen /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes du zhen /
translated: what is the perception of disenchantment with the entire world?

original: dge slong kun dga' bo /
analyzed: dge slong kun dga' bo /
translated: Bhikṣus, Ānanda,

original: 'di ni gang zhig 'jig rten pa thabs dang nye bar skye ba dang / rtog pa dang / gnas pa dang / bag la nyal ba bor te dga' ba mi skyed par ro //
analyzed: 'di ni gang zhig 'jig rten pa thabs dang nye bar skye ba dang / rtog pa dang / gnas pa dang / bag la nyal ba bor te dga' ba mi skyed par ro //
translated: it is the giving up of the arising of worldly means, thoughts, abiding, and latent tendencies, and the non-arising of joy.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,
this is

original: 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes su bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes su bstan par bya'o //
translated: the perception of disenchantment with the entire world.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'i 'du shes du zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'i 'du shes du zhe na /
translated: what is the perception of the impermanence of all conditioned things?

original: dge slong kun dga' bo /
analyzed: dge slong kun dga' bo /
translated: Bhikṣus, Ānanda,

original: 'di ni 'du byed thams cad la zhen pa med pa dang / spong ba dang / skyug bro ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'du byed thams cad la zhen pa med pa dang / spong ba dang / skyug bro ba ste /
translated: it is the non-attachment, abandonment, and disgust towards all conditioned things.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'di ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'i 'du shes su bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'i 'du shes su bstan par bya'o //
translated: this is the teaching on the perception of the impermanence of all conditioned things.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: dbugs rdub pa dang / dbyung ba rjes su dran pa du zhe na /
analyzed: dbugs rdub pa dang / dbyung ba rjes su dran pa du zhe na /
translated: how many are the recollections of the inhalation and exhalation of the breath?

original: dge slong kun dga' bo /
analyzed: dge slong kun dga' bo /
translated: Bhikṣus, Ānanda,

original: dgon pa'am / shing drung ngam /
analyzed: dgon pa'am / shing drung ngam /
translated: whether in the forest, under a tree,

original: khang stong du song ste 'dug la skyil krung bcas te lus drang por bsrang la kha gyen du bltas pa rjes su dran cing gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: khang stong du song ste 'dug la skyil krung bcas te lus drang por bsrang la kha gyen du bltas pa rjes su dran cing gnas par bya'o //
translated: or in an empty building, you should sit with your legs crossed, hold your body erect, and focus your attention in front of you.

original: de na dbugs thung du phyung na dbugs thung du phyung ngo snyam du yang dag par shes so //
analyzed: de na dbugs thung du phyung na dbugs thung du phyung ngo snyam du yang dag par shes so //
translated: If you exhale a short breath, you should know it as it is: ‘I am exhaling a short breath.’

original: dbugs ring du rdubs pa'am /🔽thung du rdubs na rdubs so snyam du yang dag par shes so //🔽dbugs ring du phyung na dbugs ring du mthong ngo snyam du yang dag par shes so //
analyzed: dbugs ring du rdubs pa'am / thung du rdubs na rdubs so snyam du yang dag par shes so // dbugs ring du phyung na dbugs ring du mthong ngo snyam du yang dag par shes so //
translated: If you inhale a long breath,🔽you should know it as it is: ‘I am inhaling a long breath.’🔽If you exhale a long breath, you should know it as it is: ‘I am exhaling a long breath.’

original: dbugs thung ba'am thung du phyung na dbugs thung du phyung ngo snyam du yang dag par shes so //
analyzed: dbugs thung ba'am thung du phyung na dbugs thung du phyung ngo snyam du yang dag par shes so //
translated: If you exhale a short breath, you should know it as it is: ‘I am exhaling a short breath.’

original: dbugs thung ba'am /
analyzed: dbugs thung ba'am /
translated: Short of breath,🔽🔽

original: thung du rgyus na thung du blta ba dang / yang dag par shes so //🔽lus kyi rnam pa thams cad yang dag par myong zhing dbugs thung du rgyus so zhes bslab par byas te lus kyi yang dag par @433b myong zhing blta zhing bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: thung du rgyus na thung du blta ba dang / yang dag par shes so // lus kyi rnam pa thams cad yang dag par myong zhing dbugs thung du rgyus so zhes bslab par byas te lus kyi yang dag par @433b myong zhing blta zhing bslab par bya'o //
translated: if it is short, he should know it as short.🔽He should train himself, thinking, “I am experiencing all the aspects of the body and breathing in a short way.”🔽He should train himself, thinking, “I am experiencing the body and breathing out in a short way.”

original: lus kyi 'du byed shin tu sbyangs nas dbugs thung du rdubs na rdubs pa la blta zhing bslab par bya'o //🔽snyam du yang dag par shes so //🔽gnyi ga mthong zhing lus kyi 'du byed yang dag par sbyangs shing rlung thung du phyung ngo zhes gnas shing bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed shin tu sbyangs nas dbugs thung du rdubs na rdubs pa la blta zhing bslab par bya'o // snyam du yang dag par shes so // gnyi ga mthong zhing lus kyi 'du byed yang dag par sbyangs shing rlung thung du phyung ngo zhes gnas shing bslab par bya'o //
translated: He should train himself, thinking, “I am experiencing the body and breathing in a long way.”🔽He should train himself, thinking, “I am experiencing the body and breathing out in a long way.”🔽He should train himself, thinking, “I am experiencing the body and breathing in, calming bodily formations.”

original: gnyi ga mthong zhing lus kyi 'du byed la blta zhing gnas par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga mthong zhing lus kyi 'du byed la blta zhing gnas par bslab par bya'o //
translated: He should train himself, thinking, “I am experiencing the body and breathing out, calming bodily formations.”

original: dga' ba yang dag par myong shing dbugs thung du rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba yang dag par myong shing dbugs thung du rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
translated: He should train himself, thinking, “I am breathing in experiencing joy.”🔽He should train himself, thinking, “I am breathing out experiencing joy.”

original: dga' ba yang dag par myong zhing blta zhing bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba yang dag par myong zhing blta zhing bslab par bya'o //
translated: I will experience joy and look at it and train in it.

original: bde ba yang dag par myong zhing dbugs thung du rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang dag par myong zhing dbugs thung du rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
translated: I will experience bliss and breathe out short breaths.

original: bde ba yang dag par myong zhing blta zhing bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang dag par myong zhing blta zhing bslab par bya'o //
translated: I will experience bliss and look at it and train in it.

original: sems kyi 'du byed yang dag par myong zhing dbugs thung du rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi 'du byed yang dag par myong zhing dbugs thung du rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
translated: I will experience mental formations and breathe out short breaths.

original: sems kyi 'du byed yang dag par myong zhing blta zhing bslab par bya'o //🔽gnyi ga mthong zhing sems kyi 'du byed yang dag par myong zhing dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi 'du byed yang dag par myong zhing blta zhing bslab par bya'o // gnyi ga mthong zhing sems kyi 'du byed yang dag par myong zhing dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
translated: I will experience mental formations and look at them and train in them.🔽I will experience both and mental formations and breathe out short breaths.

original: gnyi ga mthong zhing sems kyi 'du byed yang dag par sbyangs so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga mthong zhing sems kyi 'du byed yang dag par sbyangs so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
translated: I will experience both and mental formations and look at them and train in them.

original: sems yang dag par myong na dbugs thung du rdubs na rdubs so zhes bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sems yang dag par myong na dbugs thung du rdubs na rdubs so zhes bslab par bya'o //
translated: I will experience the mind and breathe in short breaths.

original: sems yang dag par myong zhing yang dag par sbyangs so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sems yang dag par myong zhing yang dag par sbyangs so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
translated: I am experiencing the mind and purifying the mind.🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to arouse joy in my mind.

original: @434a *// sems mngon par dga' ba bskyed pa dang / dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so zhes bslab par bya'o //🔽sems mngon par dga' ba bskyed pa dang / shin tu sbyangs so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: @434a *// sems mngon par dga' ba bskyed pa dang / dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so zhes bslab par bya'o // sems mngon par dga' ba bskyed pa dang / shin tu sbyangs so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
translated: When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to think, “I am relaxed.”🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to rest in the mind’s stability.🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to rest in insight.🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to think, “I am experiencing the mind and purifying the mind.”🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to arouse joy in my mind.🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to think, “I am relaxed.”

original: sems zhi gnas la gnas pas dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sems zhi gnas la gnas pas dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
translated: When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to rest in the mind’s stability.🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to rest in insight.🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to think, “I am experiencing the mind and purifying the mind.”🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to arouse joy in my mind.🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to think, “I am relaxed.”🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to rest in the mind’s stability.

original: sems zhi gnas la gnas pas lhag mthong du gnas par bslab par bya'o //🔽sems rnam par grol bas dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so zhes bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sems zhi gnas la gnas pas lhag mthong du gnas par bslab par bya'o // sems rnam par grol bas dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so zhes bslab par bya'o //
translated: When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to rest in insight.🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to think, “I am experiencing the mind and purifying the mind.”🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to arouse joy in my mind.🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to think, “I am relaxed.”🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to rest in the mind’s stability.🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to rest in insight.

original: sems rnam par grol bas lhag mthong la gnas par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par grol bas lhag mthong la gnas par bslab par bya'o //
translated: When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to think, “I am experiencing the mind and purifying the mind.”🔽When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to arouse joy in my mind.

original: mi rtag par rjes su blta bas dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag par rjes su blta bas dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
translated: When I breathe out a short breath, I will train to think, “I am relaxed.”

original: mi rtag par rjes su blta bas lhag mthong la gnas par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag par rjes su blta bas lhag mthong la gnas par bslab par bya'o //
translated: By observing impermanence, one should train in abiding in vipaśyanā.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar rjes su blta bas dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar rjes su blta bas dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
translated: By observing freedom from attachment, one should train in observing the exhalation of short breaths.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar rjes su blta bas lhag mthong la gnas par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar rjes su blta bas lhag mthong la gnas par bslab par bya'o //
translated: By observing freedom from attachment, one should train in abiding in vipaśyanā.

original: 'gog pa la rjes su blta bas dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su blta bas dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
translated: By observing cessation, one should train in observing the exhalation of short breaths.

original: 'gog pa la rjes su blta bas lhag mthong la gnas par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su blta bas lhag mthong la gnas par bslab par bya'o //
translated: By observing cessation, one should train in abiding in vipaśyanā.

original: so sor spong ba rjes su blta bas dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor spong ba rjes su blta bas dbugs thung du rgyus na rgyus so snyam du bslab par bya'o //
translated: By observing the elimination of faults, one should train in observing the exhalation of short breaths.

original: so sor spong bar rjes su blta bas lhag @434b mthong la gnas par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor spong bar rjes su blta bas lhag @434b mthong la gnas par bslab par bya'o //
translated: By observing the elimination of faults, one should train in abiding in vipaśyanā.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: dbugs rdub pa dang dbyung ba rjes su dran pa 'di bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dbugs rdub pa dang dbyung ba rjes su dran pa 'di bshad par bya'o //
translated: this mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation should be explained.

original: der yang kun dga' bo /
analyzed: der yang kun dga' bo /
translated: And there, Ānanda,

original: khyed ri'i kun dga' bo'i gnas su song la /
analyzed: khyed ri'i kun dga' bo'i gnas su song la /
translated: You should go to the place of Rāṣṭrapāla Ānanda.

original: 'du shes bcu po 'di bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes bcu po 'di bshad par bya'o //
translated: You should explain these ten perceptions there.

original: gnas gzhan yang yod de /
analyzed: gnas gzhan yang yod de /
translated: There is another place

original: dge slong ri'i kun dga' bos 'du shes bcu po 'di thos na de'i nad thams cad zhi bar 'gyur ro; ;de nas yang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das las mnyan te /
analyzed: dge slong ri'i kun dga' bos 'du shes bcu po 'di thos na de'i nad thams cad zhi bar 'gyur ro; ;de nas yang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das las mnyan te /
translated: where, if the monk Rāṣṭrapāla Ānanda hears these ten perceptions, all his illnesses will be healed.” Then the venerable Ānanda, having heard from the Blessed One,

original: tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo'i gnas su song nas /🔽tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo'i gnas su song nas / tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo la /
translated: went to the place of the venerable Rāṣṭrapāla Ānanda

original: 'du shes bcu so sor bshad do //
analyzed: 'du shes bcu so sor bshad do //
translated: and explained the ten perceptions🔽to the venerable Rāṣṭrapāla Ānanda.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bos 'du shes bcu po 'di rnams thos nas de'i nad thams cad zhi bar gyur to //🔽de'i nad thams cad zhi nas tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo langs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bos 'du shes bcu po 'di rnams thos nas de'i nad thams cad zhi bar gyur to // de'i nad thams cad zhi nas tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo langs te /
translated: Then, the venerable Rāṣṭrapāla Ānanda, having heard these ten perceptions, all his illnesses were healed.🔽After all his illnesses were healed, the venerable Rāṣṭrapāla Ānanda rose up

original: tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo'i nad phyis med par gyur to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo'i nad phyis med par gyur to //
translated: and the venerable Rāṣṭrapāla Ānanda became free from illness.

original: tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo'i mdo rdzogs so ////
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ri'i kun dga' bo'i mdo rdzogs so ////
translated: The Sūtra of the Venerable Rāṣṭrapāla is complete.

original: pandi ta chen po aa nanda? shr'i'i zhal snga nas /
analyzed: pandi ta chen po aa nanda? shr'i'i zhal snga nas /
translated: By the great paṇḍita Ānandāśrī.

original: mang du thos pa'i lo ts'a ba sh'akya'i dge slong nyi ma rgyal mtshan dpal bzang pos /
analyzed: mang du thos pa'i lo ts'a ba sh'akya'i dge slong nyi ma rgyal mtshan dpal bzang pos /
translated: The translator who heard much, the Śākya bhikṣu Nyima Gyaltsen Pal Zangpo,

original: skad gnyis smra ba rnams kyi gdan sa /
analyzed: skad gnyis smra ba rnams kyi gdan sa /
translated: the seat of those who speak two languages,

original: gtsug lag khang chen po dpal thar pa gling du bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang chen po dpal thar pa gling du bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: translated, edited, and finalized it at the great temple of glorious Tharpa Ling.
